messages.title: My Priorities for Gedling
messages.content: Gedling made me who I am. I grew up in Arnold and went to school there. After a career in the private and charity sectors, I want to use my skills to make the area I call home an even better place to live, work and raise a family.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I want to make our streets safer and support the Conservatives' plans to recruit 107 more officers for Nottinghamshire Police by the end of 2020-21. I’ll also support stronger sentencing, sending a clear message that we are coming after criminals.

Every child should have the chance to succeed in life. The Conservatives' £14 billion cash injection for schools will lift per pupil funding in Gedling, from £4,800 to £5,598 for secondary school pupils.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists.
mentions.tacticalSituation: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.

issues.education: English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost
issues.health: Government plans billions for hospital projects

leaflet.personalStatement: YOUR LOCAL VOICE - Gedling made me who I am. I grew up in Arnold and went to school there. After a career in the private and charity sectors, I want to use my skills to make the area I call home an even better place to live, work and raise a family.
leaflet.additionalNotes: End of the soft prison sentence. Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. LET'S GET ON WITH OUR PRIORITIES.
